segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 56
segments.en: Linked Discourses 56

segments.pli: 2. Dhammacakkappavattanavagga
segments.en: 2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma

segments.pli: 15. Paṭhamadhāraṇasutta
segments.en: 15. Remembering (1st)

segments.pli: “Dhāretha no tumhe, bhikkhave, mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti?
segments.en: “Mendicants, do you remember the four noble truths that I taught?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ahaṃ kho, bhante, dhāremi bhagavatā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti.
segments.en: “I do, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, dhāresi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti?
segments.en: “How so, mendicant?”

segments.pli: “Dukkhaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi;
segments.en: “Sir, I remember that suffering is the first noble truth you’ve taught;

segments.pli: dukkhasamudayaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dutiyaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi;
segments.en: the origin of suffering is the second;

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā tatiyaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi;
segments.en: the cessation of suffering is the third;

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi.
segments.en: and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is the fourth.

segments.pli: Evaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, dhāremi bhagavatā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I remember the four noble truths as you’ve taught them.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu.
segments.en: “Good, good, mendicant!

segments.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, dhāresi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
segments.en: It’s good that you remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

segments.pli: Dukkhaṃ kho, bhikkhu, mayā paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi;
segments.en: Suffering is the first noble truth I’ve taught, and that’s how you should remember it.

segments.pli: dukkhasamudayaṃ kho, bhikkhu, mayā dutiyaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi;
segments.en: The origin of suffering is the second;

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhaṃ kho, bhikkhu, mayā tatiyaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi;
segments.en: the cessation of suffering is the third;

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā kho, bhikkhu, mayā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi.
segments.en: and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is the fourth.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, dhārehi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
segments.en: That’s how you should remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhu, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
